intro: Dicranolepis stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-sheath fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically arranged in a rosette-like formation. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with short, horizontal stems that produce new shoots. Its leaves are dimorphic, with fertile and sterile fronds differing in size and structure. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
